Aug
30
to Sep 27

Blue Moon Type Four Group

  • Wed, Aug 30, 2023 9:30 AM 09:30 Wed, Sep 27, 2023 11:00 AM 11:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

8/30/23 first blue moon since 2020, next one is in 2026.
What better time to begin a type 4 group!

An auspicious beginning on our journey to fullness.

Wednesdays, August 30, September 6, 13, 20, 27, 2023
9:30am - 11:00am, Central Time

Facilitated by Sandra Smith and Debbi Horton
Certified Enneagram Teachers

People leading with Enneagram type Four are creative, innovative, and strategic. Their emotional attunement allows them to connect in meaningful ways that can bring ease to relationships. And, an over focus on emotional depth can serve to diminish relational depth! Seeking what is missing blinds Fours to what is here. Questions we will explore include: How does longing lead you to abandon yourself? How is your authenticity coming forward and what allows that to happen?

 This online Type Four group will explore some of the complexities of this ego structure such as the defense mechanism of “introjection” as well as the holy virtue of Equanimity and all things in between. Additionally, we’ll explore ways to cultivate a steady stable sense of self that comes from the heart. Our work together will focus on deepening self-compassion and support the arising of the Enlightened Spiritual Perspective: Holy Source.

 These five sessions will include inquiry, breakout group discussion, and self-reflection to support the teachings as we create some distance between the type structure and our True Nature. This group is limited to 16 people who are familiar with their type’s patterns. This is not an introductory offering.

Debbi Horton, MA, is a Certified Narrative Enneagram teacher and an IEA Accredited Professional. She is an active Guide with the Enneagram Prison Project. Along with Rev. Tyler Sit she developed and presents, “Moving the Race Conversation Forward with the Enneagram.” She offers spiritual direction focusing on the Enneagram and embodiment. Her TEPP (The Embodied Present Process) training with Philip Shepherd is foundational to her work.

Sandra Smith, MDiv, is a Certified Narrative Enneagram teacher and an IEA Accredited Professional. She serves as a mentor/supervisor for those seeking certification through the Narrative Enneagram as well as a mentor in the IEA Diversity Mentoring Program. Sandra offers public workshops, organizational trainings, and individual spiritual direction sessions using the Enneagram as guide. She co-hosts the podcast Heart of the Enneagram.

Cost is $160 and includes handouts
Register by emailing horton.debbi@gmail.com or sandraCsmith@charter.net
Payment by Venmo, PayPal, or check
Payment and event details to follow upon receipt of your email

Aug
29
to Sep 4

The Enneagram - Exploring Practices that Awaken Us

  • Sun, Aug 29, 2021 3:00 PM 15:00 Sat, Sep 4, 2021 11:00 AM 11:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

Join Debbi Horton and Sandra Smith at Ring Lake Ranch in Wyoming!

Whether you are new to the Enneagram System or have been working with this map for years, this week will offer space, teaching and practices to grow ourselves toward our full dimensionality in order to be compassionate participants in the world. Both silence and the beautiful, spacious Wyoming wilderness will serve as teachers and partners in our exploration. Together we will learn new deepening and grounding practices, specific to each type, that move us from automatic to authentic living, use the Enneagram Map to loosen the grip of unhealthy patterns and false inner narratives, grow in compassion toward self and others, and find encouragement with friends, new and old. Our time together will include didactic, inquiry, small group discussion, poetry and practices. Participants will leave with journaling questions that loosen automatic responses and practices (such as whole body breathing) that can sustain our presence and bring us home to ourselves.

View Event →

19
9:00 AM09:00

The Enneagram as a Guide and Support for My Ministry

  • Monday, April 19, 2021
  • 9:00 AM 12:00 PM 09:00 12:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

At its heart, the Enneagram is a tool that teaches us what separates us from ourselves, each other, and God. That’s why it is such a powerful tool in ministry. We will explore best practices for using the Enneagram in a way that invites spiritual growth instead of limiting it. We will also explore the 9 patterns of separation and paths of healing that the Enneagram identifies.

for more information: christoscenter.org

Nov
10
6:30 PM18:30

Moving the Race Conversation Forward with the Enneagram - part 3

  • Tuesday, November 10, 2020
  • 6:30 PM 8:00 PM 18:30 20:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

Co-teaching with Rev. Tyler Sit at Wisdom Ways in St. Paul, MN

In contrast to the belief that racism is a personal choice, we will explore racism as a collective, often subconscious, reality that affects literally every person who grew up in Western cultures. Like our Enneagram types, racism tells a story of who we are that is, in reality, incomplete. We will explore how each type can fall into the trap of perpetuating existing power structures, and how each type can leverage their strengths for positive change.

Registration

Nov
9
to Nov 30

The Enneagram - A Tool for Your Spiritual Journey, Mondays in November

  • Mon, Nov 9, 2020 6:45 PM 18:45 Mon, Nov 30, 2020 8:00 PM 20:00
  • Incarnation Lutheran Church (map)
  • Google Calendar ICS

Introduction to the Enneagram, November 9 & 16

What is the Enneagram? Is it relevant to me? Can I use it for spiritual growth? Join us to answer these questions! Spoiler alert… Yes, the Enneagram offers deep wisdom and insight and can be a powerful tool for self-awareness and compassion and service. We will learn the basics of the Enneagram and the 9 Enneagram styles. Debbi will describe each Enneagram style and show how it is grounded in a beautiful aspect of the divine.


Next Steps with the Enneagram, November 23 & 30

Let’s get practical. Now that I know my Enneagram type (or I’m pretty sure I do), how can I use this tool in my spiritual journey? Debbi will share helpful questions, guided imagery prayers, and blessings for each type. During our time together we will do some of these practices together. You will leave with practices you can continue to use in your journey of growth.


Debbi is a certified Enneagram teacher and an IEA (International Enneagram Association) Accredited Professional. She is also a Spiritual Director, companioning others on their spiritual journey. She loves teaching the Enneagram and teaches at many churches and at Shakopee Women’s Prison, as an Enneagram Prison Project Guide. She is on the board of the Minnesota chapter of the International Enneagram Association (MN-IEA) and served as its President for four years. Debbi co-presents Moving the Race Conversation Forward with the Enneagram, with Tyler Sit.

View Event →

Nov
5
4:30 PM16:30

Enneagram Introduction for the International Interior Design Association

  • Thursday, November 5, 2020
  • 4:30 PM 6:00 PM 16:30 18:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

Debbi will introduce us to the Enneagram: a tool that helps us understand the motivation behind our behavior. We will learn about the nine different Enneagram types and begin to determine our own type. We will also learn how this knowledge helps increase the compassion we have for ourselves and those we love.

As a system, the Enneagram conveys knowledge about nine distinct but interrelated personality styles. Each style sees and experiences the world through a different lens and moves through the world with different gifts, challenges, and opportunities for achieving growth and wholeness.

View Event →

Sep
29
7:00 PM19:00

Online Introduction to the Enneagram - part 3

  • Tuesday, September 29, 2020
  • 7:00 PM 8:30 PM 19:00 20:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

Sponsored by the MN Chapter of the International Enneagram Association (MN-IEA)

Debbi will introduce us to the Enneagram: a tool that helps us understand the motivation behind our behavior. We will learn about the nine different Enneagram types and begin to determine our own type. We will also learn how this knowledge helps increase the compassion we have for ourselves and those we love.

This is the perfect opportunity to introduce the Enneagram to folks in your life. We will learn about the nine different Enneagram types and begin to determine our own type.

Whether you are new to the Enneagram or you have been studying for a while, we all need encouragement to grow the compassion we have for ourselves and our loved ones.

Join us and invite your friends to MN-IEA's first online Enneagram Intro! We are taking advantage of being online and spreading this intro out into 3 sessions. All 3 sessions are free and open to everyone. Come for 1 or all of the sessions.

Sessions:

  • September 15 - Enneagram basics + Enneagram types 3, 7 & 8

  • September 22 - Enneagram types 4, 5, 9

  • September 29 - Enneagram types 1, 2, 6

7-8:30 pm Central Time

FREE to all, thanks to MN-IEA!!!

Separate registration for each session is required.

Click on the dates above to register for each session.

You will receive a Zoom link after you register.

Aug
10
to Aug 31

Deepening Practice Group

  • Mon, Aug 10, 2020 7:00 PM 19:00 Mon, Aug 31, 2020 8:30 PM 20:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

The Enneagram of Receptivity

The Enneagram has an uncanny way of describing us. Often when we learn our Enneagram type we wonder how this tool could know us so well. It’s very helpful to see our type patterns and habits. It’s unhelpful if we over-identify with those patterns and habits in a way that keeps us from the fullness of who we are. In this group we will do practices that invite openness, awareness, and wholeness. We’ll explore the relationship between presence, receptivity, and our Enneagram type. With compassion we’ll welcome home unintegrated parts of ourselves. 

This group is for those who know the habits and patterns of their Enneagram type. It’s not an introduction to the Enneagram.

In this group we will:

  • Learn new deepening and grounding practices 

  • Commit to a daily life-giving practice

  • Grow in compassion toward self and others

  • Find encouragement with friends, new and old

  • Engage with conversation partners each week

Our sessions will include brief teachings, breathing practices, receptivity practices, visual meditations and guided audio meditations. You’ll have on-going access to these resources.

Register Here

Dates: August 10, 17, 24, & 31
Time: 7:00-8:30 Central Time
Location: Online using Zoom (You will need a computer with a camera, microphone and internet access)

Fee: $125

Group size: 6 - 12

Comments from previous groups…

"The group was small enough to truly hear from others and listen to various experiences related to type. The poems, group exercises and readings were so well put together for personal growth to flow. The weekly assigned partner conversations were just exceptional! I would highly recommend the Deepening Practice Group to anyone seeking a deeper awareness of self."

"I liked that we did deeper work around the Enneagram."

"I appreciated the simplicity of each lesson making it accessible to rest into the practices. I appreciated the make up of the group and the various types. I appreciated being encouraged to chat with people mid week and I appreciated the wonderful meditations and handouts."

Register Here

Photos from pexels.com and unsplash.com

Jul
7
to Jul 28

Deepening Practices, 4-Week Online Enneagram Group, Tuesday Evenings

  • Tue, Jul 7, 2020 7:00 PM 19:00 Tue, Jul 28, 2020 8:30 PM 20:30
  • Google Calendar ICS

Awakening to Wholeness with the Enneagram

Deepening our practices is a gift to ourselves and our loved ones. We need each other now and always. This group is a wonderful way of receiving and offering support and encouragement.

In this small group we will:

  • Learn new deepening and grounding practices

  • Grow in compassion toward self and others

  • Find encouragement with friends, new and old

We will each set an intention for this group in order to get the most out of it. We will commit to daily life-giving practices.

July 7 - Whole body breathing practices
July 14 - Imagery and metaphor practices
July 21 - Powerful questions that loosen the grip of type
July 28 - Guided healing meditation for each type

Times for each session are 7-8:30 pm Central time.

You need to be a little familiar with the Enneagram and have a pretty good idea of your Enneagram type.

We will meet online using Zoom (a free, easy to use video meeting platform). No previous experience with Zoom is necessary. You will need a computer with a camera, microphone and internet access.

Fee: $125

Group size: 6 - 10

Comments from past participants…

"The group was small enough to truly hear from others and listen to various experiences related to type. The poems, group exercises and readings were so well put together for personal growth to flow. The weekly assigned partner conversations were just exceptional! I would highly recommend the Deepening Practice Group to anyone seeking a deeper awareness of self."

"I appreciated the simplicity of each lesson making it accessible to rest into the practices. I appreciated the make up of the group and the various types. I appreciated being encouraged to chat with people mid week and I appreciated the wonderful meditations and handouts."

"I liked that we did deeper work around the Enneagram."

Registration Form

Photo by Cristian Palmer on Unsplash

Nov
8
to Nov 10

Nine Faces of God Retreat

  • Fri, Nov 8, 2019 5:00 PM 17:00 Sun, Nov 10, 2019 1:00 PM 13:00
  • Google Calendar ICS

A Retreat: Nine Faces of God - The Enneagram and You

Using the Enneagram as a guide, we will look at nine beautiful ways we are created in God’s image. These are referred to as the essential qualities or essence of each of the nine Enneagram types. Being human means we lose touch with our essential qualities. We all yearn to reconnect and remember who we really are. The Enneagram offers insight about how we can let go of our false self and return to our true essence as we become more and more present to ourselves, others and God. Along with being informative and experiential, we will learn spiritual practices that are especially helpful for each Enneagram type and have time for individual reflection.

“I attended one of Deb's workshops on the Enneagram and was struck by how inviting she made each Enneagram type, so we could ease into our type before we found out the downside! Her materials were a great mixture of visual images, poetry, stories and written descriptions. I also appreciated the time to sit with others and delve more deeply into our types. I came away refreshed and hopeful that I could keep growing into the wholeness that the Enneagram presented.” ~Janet Hagberg; spiritual director, author, healer.

For more information and to register contact Heidi Lender at St. Andrews Lutheran Church, hlender@saintandrews.org

  • 6:30 PM 9:00 PM 18:30 21:00
  • Carondelet Center (map)
  • Google Calendar ICS

Tyler and I will be sharing the presentation we offered at the 25th International Enneagram Association Conference in Oakland CA in July 2019.

In contrast to the belief that racism is a personal choice, we will explore racism as a collective, often subconscious, reality that affects literally every person who grew up in Western cultures. Like our Enneagram types, racism tells a story of who we are that is, in reality, incomplete. We will explore how each type can fall into the trap of perpetuating existing power structures, and how each type can leverage their strengths for positive change.

We will share video clips from our interviews with people of color of each Enneagram type.

Doors open at 6:30 p.m. for networking, social time, use of the library, and sale of some library material. Program is 7-9 p.m.

Free for MN-IEA members, students and first-time guests. $20 for everyone else. No advance registration needed.
